Sentencas: This research attempts to ensure system safety while to maximize system efficiency by addressing steady state analysis and optimization for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) systems.
Titulo: Thermal management oriented steady state analysis and optimization of a kW scale solid oxide fuel cell stand-alone system for maximum system efficiency

Sentencas: Firstly, a thermal management oriented kW scale SOFC stand-alone system (primarily comprising a planar SOFC stack, a burner, and two heat exchangers) is developed, in which a special consideration for stack spatial temperature management is conducted by introducing an air bypass manifold around heat exchangers.
Titulo: Thermal management oriented steady state analysis and optimization of a kW scale solid oxide fuel cell stand-alone system for maximum system efficiency

Sentencas: The dynamic model of the system is performed using transient energy, species, and mass conservation equations.
Titulo: Thermal management oriented steady state analysis and optimization of a kW scale solid oxide fuel cell stand-alone system for maximum system efficiency

Sentencas: Secondly, based on the system model, the effects of operating parameters including fuel utilization (FU), air excess ratio (AE), bypass ratio (BR), and stack voltage (SV) on the system steady-state performances (e.g. system efficiency, stack inlet, stack outlet, and burner temperatures) are revealed.
Titulo: Thermal management oriented steady state analysis and optimization of a kW scale solid oxide fuel cell stand-alone system for maximum system efficiency

Sentencas: Particularly, an optimal relationship between the system efficiency and the operating parameters is proposed; the maximum system efficiency can certainly be obtained at the inlet outlet temperature critical point of the BR-AE or FU-AE planes for all SV operating points.
Titulo: Thermal management oriented steady state analysis and optimization of a kW scale solid oxide fuel cell stand-alone system for maximum system efficiency

Sentencas: Finally, according to the optimal relationship, a traverse optimization process is designed, and the maximum system efficiency and safe operating parameters at any efficient SV operating point are calculated.
Titulo: Thermal management oriented steady state analysis and optimization of a kW scale solid oxide fuel cell stand-alone system for maximum system efficiency

Sentencas: The results provide an optimal reference trajectory for control design, where the system is safe and efficiency optimization.
Titulo: Thermal management oriented steady state analysis and optimization of a kW scale solid oxide fuel cell stand-alone system for maximum system efficiency

Sentencas: Moreover, the results reveal two important system characteristics: (1) the burner operates within safe temperature zone as long as the temperature of the upstream stack is well controlled; (2) the control design for the system is a nonlinear optimal control with switching structure, which is a challenging control issue.
Titulo: Thermal management oriented steady state analysis and optimization of a kW scale solid oxide fuel cell stand-alone system for maximum system efficiency
